Initial client contact on August 20, 2025, regarding a motor vehicle accident involving Leanora Brown (case Leanora-Brown-MVA-8-19-2025). The contact was made by Justin.

Client details: Leanora Brown, date of birth December 6, 1974; Social Security Number [redacted]. She was transported by EMS to the University of Louisville (UofL). Injury and incident details: Reported injuries include the neck, back of the head, right shoulder, right hip and right leg, and the back. She also had a seizure in the car and had to be extracted.

episodes.original_body:
Case: Leanora-Brown-MVA-8-19-2025
Client: Leanora Brown

FILE ORGANIZATION COMPLETE - Comprehensive case file reorganization completed using 8-bucket system. Successfully reorganized 31 files with 0 errors. Results: 18 files moved to proper locations with standardized naming conventions (YYYY-MM-DD - Client Name - Category - Originator - Description), 3 duplicate files deleted (2 duplicate police reports, 1 duplicate DOCX template), all PDF+MD companion pairs reunified. Directory structure created: Client folder (3 files: Fee Agreement, Intake Form, Health Insurance Card), Investigation folder (1 file: Traffic Collision Report), Insurance folder organized by type and carrier (5 files across Root Insurance PIP, SafeCo BI, Progressive BI), Medical Records organized by provider with subfolders (9 files: Louisville Metro EMS with Medical Records/Bills/Requests subfolders, University of Louisville Hospital with Medical Records/Requests subfolders). Quality metrics: 100% naming compliance, 100% categorization accuracy, 100% execution success. Key information confirmed: Accident date 08/19/2025, rear-end collision by Betty J Antle (at-fault driver insured by SafeCo policy K3389808), client transported by Louisville Metro EMS (Incident #EMS25-00039727) to UofL Hospital (MRN T00549026), injuries include right shoulder, right hip, low back pain, seizure in vehicle requiring extraction. Insurance: Root PIP claim TJ6L8DKY ($10,000 limit, fully paid to Starlite Injury per 11/17/2025 ledger), SafeCo BI claim 060018233, Progressive BI claim 25-822910337. Medical records requests sent 10/29/2025 to both EMS and UofL Hospital. EMS bill $667.40. All files now properly organized and ready for demand preparation phase. Reorganization report saved to Reports folder.
episodes.natural_language:
Case Leanora-Brown-MVA-8-19-2025 for client Leanora Brown underwent a comprehensive file reorganization using an 8-bucket system. A total of 31 files were reorganized with zero errors. Of these, 18 files were moved to their proper locations with standardized naming conventions in the format: YYYY-MM-DD - Client Name - Category - Originator - Description. Three duplicate files were removed (two duplicate police reports and one duplicate DOCX template), and all PDF+MD companion pairs were reunified. A new directory structure was created: a Client folder containing three files (Fee Agreement, Intake Form, Health Insurance Card); an Investigation folder containing one file (Traffic Collision Report); an Insurance folder organized by type and carrier with five files across Root Insurance PIP, SafeCo BI, and Progressive BI; and Medical Records organized by provider with subfolders, including Louisville Metro EMS (Medical Records/Bills/Requests subfolders) and University of Louisville Hospital (Medical Records/Requests subfolders). Quality metrics achieved were 100% naming compliance, 100% categorization accuracy, and 100% execution success.

Key information confirmed includes the accident date of 08/19/2025, a rear-end collision caused by Betty J Antle, the at-fault driver insured by SafeCo policy K3389808. The client was transported by Louisville Metro EMS (Incident #EMS25-00039727) to University of Louisville Hospital (MRN T00549026). Injuries documented include right shoulder pain, right hip pain, low back pain, and a seizure in the vehicle requiring extraction.

Insurance details include Root PIP claim TJ6L8DKY with a $10,000 limit, which was fully paid to Starlite Injury per the ledger dated 11/17/2025; SafeCo BI claim 060018233; and Progressive BI claim 25-822910337. Medical records requests were sent on 10/29/2025 to both EMS and UofL Hospital. The EMS bill amount is $667.40.

All files are now properly organized and ready for the demand preparation phase. The reorganization report has been saved to the Reports folder.
episodes.author: Roscoe (AI Paralegal)
